Details: Both outputs provide comprehensive cost estimation reports for Ab Initio to PySpark migration with similar structure and intent. Agent_1_Output estimates total cost of $1,601.54 while Agent_2_Output estimates $1,504.13. Key differences include cluster configuration (Agent_1: 4 nodes vs Agent_2: 5 nodes), runtime estimates (Agent_1: 2.5 hours vs Agent_2: 1 hour), and pricing models used.

Both outputs address the same core objective of estimating migration costs with three main components: GCP runtime, developer effort, and API costs. Agent_1_Output focuses on 'Cost and effort estimation' while Agent_2_Output emphasizes 'Pre-conversion analysis and cost estimation'. Both include similar task breakdowns for manual effort (logic corrections, metadata alignment, rejected row handling, data reconciliation) with slight variations in estimated hours (32 vs 30 hours).

Both outputs follow nearly identical structural organization: (1) GCP Runtime Cost Estimation with cluster configuration and cost breakdown, (2) Manual Code Fixing and Data Reconciliation Effort with task tables, (3) API Cost, (4) Summary Table, (5) Notes & Recommendations/Migration Analysis. Agent_2_Output includes additional sections (References, Appendix) providing more comprehensive documentation structure.
